name: Path N Melanoma Skin
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 3:**  Any finding of melanoma in lymph nodes, regardless of size and including isolated tumor cells (ITCs), should be coded as positive lymph nodes in this field.  If only ITCs are present, assign N1.

**Note 4:**  Bilateral or contralateral nodes are considered regional nodes for head, neck, and truncal tumors with bidirectional drainage to primary nodal basins, as shown on lymphoscintigraphy.  Truncal tumors may also drain to both cephalad and caudal primary nodal basins as shown on lymphoscintigraphy.  Clinical assessment of bilateral/contralateral or cephalad/caudal regional nodal involvement is required for tumors where lymphoscintigraphy is not performed. 

**Note 5:**  Contiguous or secondary nodal basins are the next nodal drainage basins beyond the primary nodal basins.  Secondary basins are considered regional for TNM staging.

**Note 6:**  Satellite lesions/nodules or in-transit metastases are coded in this field. Assign N2c if there are satellite(s) or in-transit metastasis without regional lymph node involvement. Assign N3 if  both satellite nodules/in-transit metastases and regional lymph nodes are present.

Metastasis in one regional lymph node

Note: N1 has subcategories of N1a and N1b. Assign N1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1 [NOS]

One positive node identified by sentinel lymph node OR after completion of lymphadenectomy

Stated as N1a

One positive node clinically detected and confirmed by lymphadenectomy OR when there is gross extracapsular extension

Stated as N1b
Metastasis in two or three regional lymph nodes or satellite(s) or in-transit metastasis

Note: N2 has subcategories of N2a, N2b and N2c. Assign N2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Stated as N2 [NOS]

Two to three nodes identified by sentinel lymph node OR after completion of lymphadenectomy

Stated as N2a

Two to three nodes clinically detected and confirmed by lymphadenectomy OR when there is gross extracapsular extension

Stated as N2b
Satellite(s) or in-transit metastasis WITHOUT regional nodal metastasis

Satellite nodule(s) or in transit metastasis, distance from primary tumor less than or equal to 2 cm or distance not stated WITHOUT regional lymph node involvement.  Includes cases with ITCs only and cases with regional lymph node involvement not stated

Described as tumor with satellite nodule(s) or in transit metastasis, NOS WITHOUT regional lymph node involvement

Stated as N2c
Metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes, or matted metastatic regional lymph nodes, or satellite(s) or in-transit metastasis with metastasis in regional lymph node(s)

Matted lymph nodes

Satellite nodule(s) or in-transit metastases WITH regional lymph nodes

Stated as N3
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
